alert.note: Alert for Western Chelan County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 10 at 3:04AM PST until January 10 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations up to two inches. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations between 8 and 16 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Stevens Pass, Holden Village, and Stehekin. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 10 AM PST this morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact travel through Friday morning. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest travel information in Washington, go to https://wsdot.wa.gov/travel
